meanings.definition: An amount of alcohol that is enough to make someone drunk.
meanings.sent1: After drinking several skinfuls of beer, he stumbled out of the bar.
meanings.sent2: She had a few skinfuls of wine at the party and ended up feeling quite tipsy.
meanings.sent3: The party was so wild that even the designated driver ended up having a skinful of cocktails.
meanings.sent4: The old sailor could handle many skinfuls of rum without losing his sea legs.
meanings.sent5: The image of him carrying a skinful of moonshine in a jug was etched in her memory.

meanings.definition: A large quantity or excessive amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The farmer harvested skinfuls of ripe apples from his orchard.
meanings.sent2: She had skinfuls of homework to complete before the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The children collected skinfuls of seashells along the shore during their vacation.
meanings.sent4: The factory produced skinfuls of plastic waste that polluted the nearby river.
meanings.sent5: The magician pulled out skinfuls of colorful scarves from his hat during the show.
